description: mounted to ivory paper with blue overmat; top drawing of man wearing knickers, tall spats, simple shirt and cap, with straight hair; man seen from PR, standing, working at a table; crossbowman at bottom with PR knee on a rock, with crossbow held up; man wears a hat with two long feathers
medium: Pen and brown ink with brown-gray wash on laid paper
provenance: [Yvonne Ffrench, London]. [Davis Gallery, New York]. Malcolm and Esther Bick, Springfield, Mass. Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 2, 1984, no. 54, for Â£4,600, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1984-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Figure Studies: A Painter's Apprentice and Crossbowman
